|brand = Samsung |model = SWL-2000P |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |sernum = <!-- Serial number prefix --> |wlclass = B11 |series = <!-- Device series --> |if = PCI |if_bus_version = <!-- ie. 1.0, 1.1, 2.0, 2.2 --> |ifconnector = <!-- Interface Connector Type, Leave blank for none --> |formfactor = <!-- Connector Form Factor, Leave blank for none -->
|vendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |device_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = E2XSWL-2000P |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = 00:02:78
|chip1 = Harris;HFA3841; |chip2 = Harris;; |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = unknown |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->
|linuxdriv = |windriv = [http://web.archive.org/web/20010616114042/http://www.magiclan.com/common/download.jsp?filelocation=/cont01/w3sem/upload/support/jsp_4856.dat&content_type=application/octet-stream&filename=ml11_v311.exe here (via archive.org)]
|is_manuf = <!-- Yes, or No, --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |flags = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |802dot11_protocols = b |accessible_UART = |accessible_JTAG = |category =
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 11/23/1999 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->
|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "SAMSUNG", "11M PCI WLAN", and "REV : C9907" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
While the device is shown with a '''Lucent''' branded MAC in the FCC photos, this device appears to be PRISM based.
The Windows PCMCIA device string for this product is presumed to be... *PCMCIA\SAMSUNG-11Mbps_WLAN_PCI_Card-BD65 **'''SAMSUNG 11Mbps Wireless LAN PCI Card'''
The device uses a '''Cirrus Logic''' / '''Basis Communications''' CL-PD6729-QC-E PCI->PCMCIA host adapter.
==Links of Interest== [http://www.monkey.org/openbsd/archive/misc/0111/msg01048.html '''Wavelan SAMSUNG SWL-2000P''' on an openbsd mailing list from 2001] :00:02:78 OUI ('''Samsung''')
[[Category:English Documentation]]
